channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Ex-Olympian Stan Wild continued gym coaching after abuse claim
item.description: Stan Wild represented Great Britain at two Olympic Games and founded his own York gymnastics club.

item.title: Chingford stabbing: Two boys held after man killed in street
item.description: The 14-year-olds are in custody following the death of James Markham in east London on Monday.

item.title: GCSES 2021: Higher results expected after exams axed
item.description: Pupils are finding out their GCSE results, as a second year of bumper grades is predicted.

item.title: Esther Dingley: Missing hiker's body retrieved by police
item.description: The body and belongings of Esther Dingley were found close to where a bone fragment was discovered.

item.title: Sheffield girlfriend gives partner 'gift of life' kidney donation
item.description: Eddie Huntley has a rare disease and was on dialysis three times a week before the transplant.

item.title: Success for women's skateboarding group after Olympic triumph
item.description: Team GB's Olympic skateboarders inspire new interest in Leeds all-female skateboarding group.

item.title: Covid: Blackpool tops post-lockdown footfall recovery list
item.description: Blackpool's footfall since restrictions were eased is higher than it was before the pandemic, a study finds.

item.title: Bilsdale transmitter fire: TV and radio services largely restored
item.description: After a blackout of more than 24 hours, BBC TV channels for most homes are restored.

item.title: Postcard from Chile arrives in Dorset after 30 years
item.description: The recipient was 'slightly confused' when it landed on his doormat three decades late.

item.title: Horndean dog theft: Teen arrested after pet snatched from boy
item.description: A 17-year-old boy is arrested on suspicion of robbery after border terrier Melchy was stolen.

item.title: Blockbusters on Trafalgar Square big screen aim to woo film fans
item.description: The six free blockbuster screenings are part of an effort to encourage people to return to cinemas.

item.title: Blind couple refused entry by Leicester Square restaurants
item.description: Siobhan Meade and her husband were turned away from two Leicester Square restaurants.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Galal Yafai returns to UK from Tokyo
item.description: Galal Yafai was met with cheers and chanting as he arrived at London Heathrow Airport from Tokyo.

item.title: Alex Reid death: Mother completes 624-mile run for heart screening charity
item.description: Heather Reid completes mammoth run in honour of daughter who died from undetected heart condition.

item.title: Baby loss: 'Our world grows around the grief'
item.description: Ross Coniam set up the Dads and Lads Network for men who have gone through baby loss.

item.title: Birmingham riots: Tariq Jahan reflects 10 years on
item.description: Tariq Jahan says he forgives the men who killed his son during the 2011 riots in Birmingham.

item.title: National Trust adapts Oxburgh Hall's roof tiles for bats
item.description: A coating of paint mixed with sand allows the creatures at a stately home to grip on the roof.

item.title: First barn owl chicks fledge from Bere Marsh renovated barn
item.description: Barn owls are breeding in the barn in Dorset for the first time since its roof was replaced.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup: Chelsea defeat Villarreal on penalties in Belfast to lift trophy for second time
item.description: Chelsea beat Villarreal 6-5 in a penalty shootout to lift the Uefa Super Cup for a second time after a draining 120 minutes of action ends 1-1 in Belfast.

item.title: England v India: Stuart Broad out of series - James Anderson doubt for second Test
item.description: Stuart Broad will miss the remainder of England's series against India because of a calf tear and James Anderson is a doubt for the second Test.

item.title: The Hundred: Brave go top of the table, Fire crash out
item.description: Southern Brave cruise to a comfortable win over Welsh Fire which takes them to the top of the table.

item.title: Tammy Abraham: Roma step up pursuit of Chelsea and England striker
item.description: Roma's general manager Tiago Pinto arrives in London in an attempt to complete the signing of Chelsea striker Tammy Abraham.

item.title: Johanna Konta beats Elina Svitolina to reach Canadian Open third round
item.description: British number one Johanna Konta fights back from a set down to defeat third seed Elina Svitolina and reach the Canadian Open third round.
